THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION
ON 17.01.2024, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE
FOLLOWING:

Bl
alates
2024/KER/3376
Crl.M.C.No.438 of 2024 2
SOPHY THOMAS, J.
"Dated this the 17" day of January, 2024.
ORDER
This Crl.M.C. under Section 482 of Cr.P.C. is filed
by the accused in Crime No.3167 of 2017 of Chavara
Police Station, Kollam District, which is now pending
before the Fast Track Special Court (POCSO),
Karunagappally as LP No.4/2021, to quash the non-
bailable warrant pending against him.

2. The petitioner was charge sheeted for the
offence punishable under Section 376(2) of the Indian
Penal Code and he was granted anticipatory bail by this
Court as per Annexure Al order dated 7.1.2020. There
was no direction in that order, that he shall not go abroad
and accordingly, to eke out a living, he went to Ukraine
on 9.1.2021. Thereafter, due to COVID-19 pandemic

Bl
aa
2024/KER/3376
Crl.M.C.No.438 of 2024 3
restrictions and also due to the civil war in Ukraine, he
could not come back to India and by that time, due to his
absence, the case was transferred to LP Register as LP
No.4/2021. Now, the petitioner is available in India and
he wants to surrender before the Fast Track Special Court
(POCSO), Karunagappally. His prayer is to quash the
non-bailable warrant pending against him, so as to
enable him to surrender before the court.

3. Heard learned counsel for the petitioner, and
learned Public Prosecutor, on behalf oof the
respondents /State.

4. Earlier the petitioner was released on Anticipatory
Bail and there was no restriction for him to go abroad.
Accordingly, he went abroad. Thereafter, due to COVID-

19 pandemic and the civil war in Ukraine, he could not
come back. So, the petitioner is at liberty to surrender
before the Fast Track Special Court (POCSO),
Karunagappally in LP No.4/2021 on or before 25.1.2024

Bel
ur Bais ‘
lea
2024/KER/3376
Crl.M.C.No.438 of 2024 4
and file an application for bail. The learned trial court
shall consider his application, on evaluating the factual
situations pleaded by him, and dispose the application on
the date of surrender itself. Till the petitioner surrenders
before the Fast Track Special Court, the non-bailable
warrant pending against him in LP No.4/2021 shall be
kept in abeyance.
With these directions, this Crl.M.C. is disposed of.
Sd/-
SOPHY THOMAS,
JUDGE
